Berlin.title: Berlin
Berlin.description: Berlin is the capital and largest city of Germany, both by area and by population.

Berlin.title: Old Synagogue (Berlin)
Berlin.description: The Old Synagogue (German: Alte Synagoge) was a synagogue in the Berlin district of Marienviertel (present-day Mitte).

Berlin.title: St. Mary's Church, Berlin
Berlin.description: St.

Berlin.title: Mitte (locality)
Berlin.description: Mitte (German pronunciation: [ˈmɪtə] ) (German for "middle" or "center") is a central section (Ortsteil) of Berlin, Germany, in the eponymous borough (Bezirk) of Mitte.

Berlin.title: Neptunbrunnen (Berlin)
Berlin.description: The Neptune Fountain (German: Neptunbrunnen) in Berlin was built in 1891 and was designed by Reinhold Begas.

Berlin.title: AquaDom
Berlin.description: The AquaDom (mixed Latin and German: 'water dome', more formally 'water cathedral') was a 25-metre-tall (82 ft) cylindrical acrylic glass aquarium with built-in transparent elevator inside the lobby of the Radisson Collection Hotel in the DomAquarée complex at Karl-Liebknecht-Straße in Berlin-Mitte, Germany.

Berlin.title: East Berlin
Berlin.description: East Berlin (German: Ost-Berlin; pronounced [ˈɔstbɛʁˌliːn] ) was the capital city of East Germany (GDR) from 1948 to 1990, although in 1945, it was recognised by the Three Powers (United States, United Kingdom, and France) as the Soviet occupation sector of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Berlin Dungeon
Berlin.description: Berlin Dungeon is a tourist attraction from a chain including the London Dungeon and Hamburg Dungeon.

Berlin.title: Marx-Engels Forum
Berlin.description: Marx-Engels-Forum is a public park in the central Mitte district of Berlin, the capital of Germany.

Berlin.title: Rosenstrasse protest
Berlin.description: The Rosenstrasse protest is considered to be a significant event in German history as it is the only mass public demonstration by Germans in the Third Reich against the deportation of Jews.

Berlin.title: Karl-Liebknecht-Straße
Berlin.description: Karl-Liebknecht-Straße is a major street in the central Mitte district of the German capital Berlin.

Berlin.title: DDR Museum
Berlin.description: The DDR Museum is a museum in the centre of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Rotes Rathaus (Berlin U-Bahn)
Berlin.description: Rotes Rathaus is a subway station in Berlin's Mitte district.

Berlin.title: Liebknecht Bridge
Berlin.description: Liebknecht Bridge (German: Liebknechtbrücke) is a bridge in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Raid on Berlin
Berlin.description: The Raid on Berlin took place in October 1760 during the Third Silesian War (part of the Seven Years' War) when Austrian and Russian forces occupied the Prussian capital of Berlin for several days.

Berlin.title: Rotes Rathaus
Berlin.description: The Rotes Rathaus (German: [ˈʁoːtəs ˈʁaːtˌhaʊs] , Red City Hall) is the town hall of Berlin, Germany, located in the Mitte district on Rathausstraße near Alexanderplatz.

Berlin.title: Berlin Cathedral
Berlin.description: Berlin Cathedral (German: Berliner Dom), also known as the Evangelical Supreme Parish and Collegiate Church, is a monumental German Protestant  church and dynastic tomb (House of Hohenzollern) on the Museum Island in central Berlin.

Berlin.title: Ethnological Museum of Berlin
Berlin.description: The Ethnological Museum of Berlin (German: Ethnologisches Museum Berlin) is one of the Berlin State Museums (German: Staatliche Museen zu Berlin), the de facto national collection of the Federal Republic of Germany.

Berlin.title: Berlin Palace
Berlin.description: The Berlin Palace (German: Berliner Schloss), formally the Royal Palace (German: Königliches Schloss), adjacent to the Berlin Cathedral and the Museum Island in the Mitte area of Berlin, was the main residence of the House of Hohenzollern from 1443 to 1918.

Berlin.title: Palace of the Republic, Berlin
Berlin.description: The Palace of the Republic (German: Palast der Republik) was a building in Berlin that hosted the Volkskammer, the parliament of East Germany, from 1976 to 1990.

Berlin.title: Museum of Asian Art
Berlin.description: The Museum of Asian Art (German: Museum für Asiatische Kunst) is a part of the Humboldt Forum in Berlin since 2020.

Berlin.title: Humboldt Forum
Berlin.description: The Humboldt Forum is a museum dedicated to human history, art and culture, located in the Berlin Palace on the Museum Island in the historic centre of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Schloßplatz (Berlin)
Berlin.description: Schloßplatz (German for "Palace Square" or "Castle Square") is a square located on Museum Island (Museumsinsel) in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Friedrichs Bridge
Berlin.description: Friedrichs Bridge (German: Friedrichsbrücke) is a bridge in Berlin, one of several crossing the Spree between Museum Island and the mainland portion of Mitte.

Berlin.title: Rathaus Bridge
Berlin.description: Rathaus Bridge (German: Rathausbrücke, "Town Hall Bridge") is a bridge in the central Mitte district of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Cölln
Berlin.description: Cölln (German: [ˈkœln]) was the twin city of Old Berlin (Altberlin) from the 13th century to the 18th century.

Berlin.description: The Neuer Marstall (English: New Stables) is a listed historic building in Berlin, Germany located on the Schloßplatz and the Spree River.

Berlin.title: Alt-Berlin
Berlin.description: Alt-Berlin ("Old Berlin"), also spelled Altberlin, is a neighborhood (Stadtviertel), situated in the Berliner locality (Ortsteil) of Mitte, part of the homonymous borough.

Berlin.title: Gerettet
Berlin.description: Gerettet is a sculpture by Adolf Brütt, installed in the Kolonnadenhof outside the Alte Nationalgalerie in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Lustgarten
Berlin.description: The Lustgarten (German: [ˈlʊstˌɡaʁtn̩] , Pleasure Garden) is a park in Museum Island in central Berlin at the foreground of the Altes Museum.

Berlin.description: The St.

Berlin.description: The Hemp Museum (German: Hanf Museum Berlin) was opened in Berlin on 6 December 1994.

Berlin.description: The equestrian statue of Frederick William IV is an 1875–86 sculpture of Frederick William IV of Prussia by Alexander Calandrelli, installed in front of the Alte Nationalgalerie in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.description: Löwenkämpfer (The Lion Fighter) is an 1858 bronze equestrian statue by Albert Wolff, installed outside the Altes Museum in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.description: The Fragment from the tomb of Nikarete from the third quarter of the fourth century BC, found near Athens is displayed today in the Antikensammlung of the Altes Museum in Berlin.

Berlin.description: The Altes Museum (English: Old Museum) is a listed building on the Museum Island in the historic centre of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.description: The Berlin glass amphora from Olbia (German: Berliner Glasamphora aus Olbia) is a Hellenistic glass vessel in the shape of an amphora, which is now kept in the Antikensammlung Berlin.

Berlin.description: The Alte Nationalgalerie (lit.

Berlin.description: The Ephraim Palace (German: Ephraim-Palais) is a Rococo-style building in Berlin, Germany, originally constructed in 1766.

Berlin.description: Hercules and the Nemean Lion is a sculpture of Hercules fighting the Nemean lion by Max Klein, installed in the Kolonnadenhof outside the Alte Nationalgalerie in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Severan Tondo
Berlin.description: The Severan Tondo or Berlin Tondo from c.

Berlin.description: The oinochoe by the Shuvalov Painter in the collection of Antikensammlung Berlin (inventory number F 2414) is an erotic depiction from ancient Greek vase painting.

Berlin.description: The Berlin Foundry Cup (German: Erzgießerei-Schale) is a red-figure kylix (drinking cup) from the early 5th century BC.

Berlin.description: The Egyptian Museum of Berlin (German: Ägyptisches Museum und Papyrussammlung) is home to one of the world's most important collections of ancient Egyptian artefacts, including the iconic Nefertiti Bust.

Berlin.description: The James Simon Gallery (German: James-Simon-Galerie) is a centrally located visitor center and art gallery between the reconstructed Neues Museum and the Kupfergraben arm of the Spree river on Museum Island in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Neues Museum
Berlin.description: The Neues Museum (New Museum) is a listed building on the Museum Island in the historic centre of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Hackesche Höfe
Berlin.description: The Hackesche Höfe (English: Hacke's Courtyards) is a notable courtyard complex situated adjacent to the Hackescher Markt in the centre of Berlin.

Berlin.title: North German Confederation
Berlin.description: The North German Confederation (German: ) was initially a German military alliance established in August 1866 under the leadership of the Kingdom of Prussia, which was transformed in the subsequent year into a confederated state (a de facto federal state) that existed from July 1867 to December 1870.

Berlin.title: Brandenburg-Prussia
Berlin.description: Brandenburg-Prussia (German: Brandenburg-Preußen; Low German: Brannenborg-Preußen) is the historiographic denomination for the early modern realm of the Brandenburgian Hohenzollerns between 1618 and 1701.

Berlin.title: Molkenmarkt
Berlin.description: Molkenmarkt (literally: "whey market") is the oldest square in Berlin.

Berlin.title: Eiserne Bridge

Berlin.description: The Berlin Central and Regional Library (German: Zentral- und Landesbibliothek Berlin) or ZLB is the official library of the City and State of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Monument to Freedom and Unity
Berlin.description: The Monument to Freedom and Unity (German: Denkmal für Freiheit und Einheit) is a planned national German monument in Berlin commemorating the country's peaceful reunification in 1990 and earlier 18th, 19th and 20th century unification movements.

Berlin.title: Jüdenstraße
Berlin.description: The Jüdenstraße (German: Street of the Jews), is a street in central Berlin, the capital of Germany.

Berlin.description: The Evangelisches Gymnasium zum Grauen Kloster, located in suburban Schmargendorf, Berlin, is an independent school with a humanistic profile, known as one of the most prestigious schools in Germany.

Berlin.description: The European School of Management and Technology, also known as ESMT Berlin, is a private non-profit business school based in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Mühlendamm
Berlin.description: Mühlendamm (Mill Dam) is a major thoroughfare in the central Mitte district of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Weinmeisterstraße (Berlin U-Bahn)
Berlin.description: Weinmeisterstraße  is a Berlin U-Bahn station located on the U8.

Berlin.description: The Vorderasiatisches Museum (German: [ˈfɔʁdɐ.

Berlin.title: State Council Building
Berlin.description: The State Council Building (German: Staatsratsgebäude) is a building in the former East Berlin that hosted the State Council (German: Staatsrat), the collective head of state of the German Democratic Republic (East Germany or GDR), from 1964 to 1990.

Berlin.title: Franziskaner-Klosterkirche
Berlin.description: The Franziskaner-Klosterkirche was a church in the Mitte district of Berlin, founded in 1250 and now in ruins.

Berlin.description: Altes Stadthaus ("Old City Hall") is a former administrative building in Berlin, Germany, currently used by the Senate.

Berlin.description: The 1757 raid on Berlin  took place during the Third Silesian War (part of the Seven Years' War).

Berlin.description: The World Clock (German: Weltzeituhr), also known as the Urania World Clock (German: Urania-Weltzeituhr), is a large turret-style world clock located in the public square of Alexanderplatz in Mitte, Berlin.

Berlin.description: The Kommandantenhaus (Commandant's House), also called Alte Kommandantur (Old Commandantura), on Unter den Linden boulevard in the historic centre of Berlin is the former headquarter of the city's commandant.

Berlin.description: The German Historical Museum (German: Deutsches Historisches Museum), known by the acronym DHM, is a museum in Berlin, Germany devoted to German history.

Berlin.description: The Museum of Islamic Art (German: Museum für Islamische Kunst) is located in the Pergamon Museum and is part of the Staatliche Museen zu Berlin.

Berlin.description: A Relief depicting a Roman legionary (German: Relief mit der Darstellung eines römischen Legionärs) is located in the Pergamonmuseum and belongs to the Antikensammlung Berlin.

Berlin.description: The Bauakademie (Building Academy, also known as the Schinkelsche Bauakademie) in Berlin, Germany, was a higher education institution for the art of building to train master builders.

Berlin.title: Zeughaus
Berlin.description: The Zeughaus (English: Arsenal) is a listed building and the oldest structure on Unter den Linden boulevard in the historic centre of Berlin.

Berlin.description: The Park Inn by Radisson Berlin Alexanderplatz is the second tallest building in Berlin and the 42th-tallest building and tallest hotel-only building in Germany.

Berlin.title: Mshatta Facade

Berlin.title: Market Gate of Miletus

Berlin.description: The Grosse Hamburger Strasse, also Große Hamburger Straße, located in the Mitte district of Berlin, has been an important site for Jewish Berliners.

Berlin.title: Monbijou Palace
Berlin.description: Monbijou Palace was a Rococo palace in central Berlin located in the present-day Monbijou Park on the north bank of the Spree river across from today's Bode Museum and within sight of the Hohenzollern city palace.

Berlin.title: Parochialkirche
Berlin.description: The Parochialkirche (literally the Reformed parochial church) is a Reformed church in the Klosterviertel neighbourhood of the Mitte borough in Berlin.

Berlin.title: Monbijou Park
Berlin.description: Monbijou Park is a park in Mitte, a district of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.description: The Palais am Festungsgraben (“Palace on the Moat”), originally known as the Palais Donner, is a stately building in Berlin’s Mitte subdistrict located behind, and facing, the ensemble of chestnut trees around the Neue Wache (“New Guardhause”), near the eastern terminus of the boulevard Unter den Linden.

Berlin.title: Klosterstraße (Berlin U-Bahn)
Berlin.description: Klosterstraße is a Berlin U-Bahn station located on the U2 in the centrally located Mitte district.

Berlin.title: Museum Island
Berlin.description: The Museum Island (German: Museumsinsel) is a museum complex on the northern part of the Spree Island in the historic heart of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Maxim Gorki Theater

Berlin.title: Friedrichswerder Church

Berlin.title: Prinzessinnenpalais

Berlin.title: Neue Wache

Berlin.title: Sophienkirche (Berlin)
Berlin.description: The Sophienkirche is a  Protestant church in the Spandauer Vorstadt part of the Berlin-Mitte region of Berlin, eastern Germany.

Berlin.title: Embassy of the Netherlands, Berlin
Berlin.description: The Embassy of the Netherlands in Berlin (Dutch: Nederlandse ambassade te Berlijn, German: Niederländische Botschaft in Deutschland) is the Netherlands's diplomatic mission in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Königsstädtisches Theater
Berlin.description: Königsstädtisches Theater was the name of different theater buildings in Berlin in the 19th and 20th century.

Berlin.title: Jungfern Bridge
Berlin.description: The Jungfern Bridge (German: Jungfernbrücke) is a bridge in Berlin.

Berlin.title: Alexa Centre

Berlin.title: Bust of Nicolas Poussin

Berlin.title: Bode Museum

Berlin.title: Cupid Carving His Bow
Berlin.description: Cupid Carving His Bow is a marble sculpture by the Flemish artist François Duquesnoy.

Berlin.title: Spandauer Vorstadt
Berlin.description: Spandauer Vorstadt ("Spandauer suburb", formerly also called Spandauer Quarter or Spandauer Viertel) is a historic district in what is now the Mitte district of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Lindentunnel
Berlin.description: The Lindentunnel is a partially filled tunnel under the boulevard Unter den Linden in the Berlin district of Mitte.

Berlin.title: Scheunenviertel

Berlin.title: Kino Babylon

Berlin.description: The Barenboim–Said Akademie (German: Barenboim-Said Akademie, Arabic: أكاديمية بارنبويم-سعيد, Hebrew: אקדמיית ברנבוים-סעיד) is an academy located in Berlin, Germany, offering bachelor's degrees and Artist Diploma certificates in music; it opened on 8 December 2016.

Berlin.description: The Staatsoper Unter den Linden (lit.

Berlin.description: The Alexander von Humboldt Memorial to the right of the Humboldt University main building on Unter den Linden avenue in Berlin's Mitte district commemorates the Prussian polymath and natural scientist Alexander von Humboldt (1769–1859).

Berlin.title: Statue of Hermann von Helmholtz
Berlin.description: The statue of Hermann von Helmholtz by Ernst Herter is located at Humboldt University of Berlin in Berlin-Mitte, Germany.

Berlin.title: Statue of Max Planck
Berlin.description: The statue of Max Planck by Bernhard Heiliger at Humboldt University of Berlin in Berlin-Mitte, Germany.

Berlin.title: Humboldt University of Berlin
Berlin.description: The Humboldt University of Berlin (German: Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, abbreviated HU Berlin) is a public research university in the central borough of Mitte in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Jewel Palace (Berlin)
Berlin.description: The Jewel Palace (German: Juwel-Palais) is a Neo-Gothic-style building in Berlin-Mitte.

Berlin.title: Statue of Theodor Mommsen
Berlin.description: The statue of Theodor Mommsen by Adolf Brütt is located at Humboldt University of Berlin in Berlin-Mitte, Germany.

Berlin.title: House of Travel
Berlin.description: The House of Travel (German: Haus des Reisens) is a 18-story building at Alexanderplatz in the Mitte district of Berlin.

Berlin.title: St. Hedwig's Cathedral
Berlin.description: St.

Berlin.title: Bebelplatz
Berlin.description: The Bebelplatz (formerly and colloquially the Opernplatz) is a public square in the central Mitte district of Berlin, the capital of Germany.

Berlin.title: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Berlin
Berlin.description: The Archdiocese of Berlin (Latin: Archidioecesis Berolinensis) is a Latin Church ecclesiastical territory or archdiocese of the Catholic Church in Germany.

Berlin.description: Rosa-Luxemburg-Straße is a street in central Berlin, the capital of Germany.

Berlin.description: The Karl-Liebknecht-Haus or Karl Liebknecht House is the headquarters of the party The Left in Germany.

Berlin.description: The Battle of Berlin (November 1943 to March 1944) was a bombing campaign against Berlin by RAF Bomber Command along with raids on other German cities to keep German defences dispersed.

Berlin.title: Rosa-Luxemburg-Platz

Stockholm.title: Swedish Army Museum
Stockholm.description: The Swedish Army Museum (Swedish: Armémuseum) is a museum of military history located in the district of Östermalm in Stockholm.

Stockholm.title: Guldbron
Stockholm.description: Guldbron "The Golden Bridge", formally Slussbron, is the main bridge for road traffic as well as pedestrians and cyclists that will connect the Old Town of Stockholm with Södermalm.

Stockholm.title: Humlegården
Stockholm.description: Humlegården is a major park in the district of Östermalm in Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Sturegatan
Stockholm.description: Sturegatan is a street in the borough of Östermalm in Stockholm.

Stockholm.title: St. Paul's Church, Mariatorget

Stockholm.title: Rådhuset metro station
Stockholm.description: Rådhuset metro station is a rapid transit station in Kungsholmen in central Stockholm, part of the Stockholm metro.

Stockholm.title: Karlaplan metro station
Stockholm.description: Karlaplan metro station is a station on the red line of the Stockholm metro, located at Karlaplan in the district of Östermalm.

Stockholm.title: Sophiahemmet University College
Stockholm.description: Sophiahemmet University (Swedish: Sophiahemmet Högskola) is a Swedish institution for higher education associated with Sophiahemmet.

Stockholm.title: Odengatan
Stockholm.description: Odengatan is a major street in the districts Vasastan and Östermalm in central Stockholm.

Stockholm.title: Acne Studios
Stockholm.description: Acne Studios is a multidisciplinary luxury fashion house based in Stockholm, Sweden that specializes in men's and women's ready-to-wear fashion, footwear, accessories and denim.

Stockholm.title: Stockholm International School
Stockholm.description: Stockholm International School (SIS) provides an international education in English to just over 820  students aged 3–18 (January 2024 figures) in the heart of Sweden's capital.

Stockholm.title: 2010 Stockholm bombings
Stockholm.description: On 11 December 2010, two bombs exploded in central Stockholm, killing the bomber.

Stockholm.title: Hötorget metro station
Stockholm.description: Hötorget, formerly known as Kungsgatan, is an underground station on the Green line of the Stockholm metro.

Stockholm.title: Norrmalm
Stockholm.description: Norrmalm is a city district in Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: 2017 Stockholm truck attack
Stockholm.description: On 7 April 2017, a vehicle-ramming Islamist terrorist attack took place in central Stockholm, the capital of Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Sveriges Riksbank
Stockholm.description: Sveriges Riksbank, or simply the Riksbank, is the central bank of Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Klara Church
Stockholm.description: The Church of Saint Clare or Klara Church (Swedish: Klara kyrka) is a church in central Stockholm.

Stockholm.title: Solnabron
Stockholm.description: Solnabron (Swedish: "The Solna Bridge") was a viaduct in Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Ministry of Culture (Sweden)
Stockholm.description: The Ministry of Culture (Swedish: Kulturdepartementet) is a ministry within the government of Sweden responsible for culture policy.

Stockholm.title: Stockholm
Stockholm.description: Stockholm (Swedish: [ˈstɔ̂kː(h)ɔlm] ) is the capital and most populous city of Sweden as well as the largest urban area in the Nordic countries.

Stockholm.title: Ministry of Health and Social Affairs (Sweden)
Stockholm.description: The Ministry of Health and Social Affairs (Swedish: Socialdepartementet) is a ministry in the Government of Sweden responsible for policies related to social welfare: social security, social services, medical and health care, public health and the rights of children, the elderly and disabled people.

Stockholm.title: Riksbron
Stockholm.description: Riksbron (Swedish: "The National Bridge" or "The State Bridge") is an arch bridge in central Stockholm, Sweden, leading from Drottninggatan on Norrmalm 44 metres (144 ft) over to Riksgatan on Helgeandsholmen.

Stockholm.title: Radiohuset (Stockholm)
Stockholm.description: Radiohuset ("the radio house") in Östermalm, Stockholm, is the main headquarters building of  Sveriges Radio (SR).

Stockholm.title: Kungsholm Church
Stockholm.description: Kungsholm Church (Swedish: Kungsholms kyrka) or Ulrika Eleonora Church (Swedish: Ulrika Eleonora kyrka) is a church building at Bergsgatan on the island of Kungsholmen in Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Kolmätargränd
Stockholm.description: Kolmätargränd is a small alley in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Cattelin
Stockholm.description: Catellin was a landmark restaurant in Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Köpmanbrinken
Stockholm.description: Köpmanbrinken (Swedish: "Merchant's Slope") is a street composed of two slopes, in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Didrik Ficks Gränd
Stockholm.description: Didrik Ficks Gränd (Swedish: "Alley of Didrik Fick") is an alley in Gamla stan, the old town of Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Kindstugatan
Stockholm.description: Kindstugatan  is a street in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: The Four Elements (sculpture)
Stockholm.description: The Four Elements is a monumental mobile sculpture created by the American sculptor Alexander Calder in 1961.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda County
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda County (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos apskritis) is one of ten counties in Lithuania, bordering Tauragė County to the southeast, Telšiai County to the northeast, Kurzeme in Latvia to the north, and Kaliningrad Oblast in Russia to the south.

Klaipeda.description: The Church of St.

Klaipeda.description: Lithuania Business College (Lithuanian: Lietuvos verslo kolegija, LTVK) is a private college located in Klaipėda and Vilnius, Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Castle
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda Castle, also known as Memelburg or Memel Castle, is an archeological site and museum housed in a castle built by the Teutonic Knights in Klaipėda, Lithuania, near the Baltic Sea.

Klaipeda.title: Arka (monument)
Klaipeda.description: Arka (transl.

Klaipeda.title: LKL Sūduvis (M52)
Klaipeda.description: LKL Sūduvis (M52) is a minehunter of the Lithuanian Naval Force.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda ( CLAY-ped-ə; Lithuanian: [ˈkɫɐɪpʲeːdɐ] ; German: Memel) is a city in Lithuania on the Baltic Sea coast.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Revolt
Klaipeda.description: The Klaipėda Revolt took place in January 1923 in the Klaipėda Region (also known as the Memel Territory or Memelland).

Klaipeda.title: Akropolis (Klaipėda)
Klaipeda.description: Akropolis is the biggest shopping center in Klaipėda and the sixth largest shopping mall  in Lithuania with 76,410 m2 (820,000 sq ft).

Klaipeda.title: Pilsotas
Klaipeda.description: Pilsotas is a 34-story building in the Gandrališkės residential district of Klaipėda, Lithuania designed by Donatas Rakauskas, completed in May 2007.

Klaipeda.title: Švyturys Arena
Klaipeda.description: Švyturio Arena (English: Lighthouse Arena) is an indoor arena in Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda railway station
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda railway station (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos geležinkelio stotis) is a Lithuanian Railways station in Klaipėda.

Klaipeda.title: Smiltynė
Klaipeda.description: Smiltynė (German: Sandkrug) is a part of Klaipėda city municipality in Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Port of Klaipėda
Klaipeda.description: The Port of Klaipėda is a seaport located in Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda University
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda University (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos universitetas or KU) is a university in the Lithuanian port city of Klaipėda.

Klaipeda.title: LCC International University
Klaipeda.description:
LCC International University, formerly Lithuania Christian College (LCC), is a liberal arts institution in the city of Klaipėda, Lithuania, established in 1991
by a joint venture of Lithuanian, Canadian and American foundations.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Free Economic Zone
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda Free Economic Zone or Klaipėda FEZ (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos laisvoji ekonominė zona) is the first free economic zone in the Baltics.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Central Stadium
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda Central Stadium (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos centrinis stadionas) is a football stadium in Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Lighthouse
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda Lighthouse (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos švyturys) - a lighthouse located in Klaipėda, on the Lithuanian coast of the Baltic Sea; located 500 metres from the coast.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Combined Heat and Power Plant
Klaipeda.description: Gren Klaipėda, formerly Fortum Klaipėda, is combined heat and power plant in Klaipėda, Lithuania and it uses biomass and waste to produce energy.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Geothermal Demonstration Plant
Klaipeda.description: The Klaipėda Geothermal Demonstration Plant is a geothermal heating plant in Klaipėda, Lithuania, constructed during the late 1990s and early 2000s.

Klaipeda.title: FSRU Independence
Klaipeda.description: FSRU Independence, delivered in March 2014 is a LNG carrier designed as a floating LNG storage and regasification unit (FSRU) chartered by KN to be used as a LNG import terminal in Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda LNG terminal
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda LNG terminal (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos suskystintų gamtinių dujų terminalas) is a liquefied natural gas import terminal in the port of Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Kiaulės Nugara
Klaipeda.description: Kiaulės Nugara is an island in the Curonian Lagoon, Port of Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Varpas gymnasium
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda "Varpas" gymnasium (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos „Varpo“ gimnazija) is a Lithuanian language gymnasium school located in Bandužiai neighborhood, Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo subway sarin attack
Tokyo.description: The Tokyo subway sarin attack (地下鉄サリン事件, Chikatetsu Sarin Jiken, "Subway Sarin Incident") was an act of domestic terrorism perpetrated on 20 March 1995, in Tokyo, Japan, by members of the cult movement Aum Shinrikyo.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo Metropolitan Government
Tokyo.description: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government (東京都庁, Tōkyōto-chō) is the government of the Tokyo Metropolis.

Tokyo.title: Greater Tokyo Area
Tokyo.description: The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world, consisting of the Kantō region of Japan (including Tokyo Metropolis and the prefectures of Chiba, Gunma, Ibaraki, Kanagawa, Saitama, and Tochigi) as well as the prefecture of Yamanashi of the neighboring Chūbu region.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo
Tokyo.description: Tokyo (; Japanese: 東京, Tōkyō, [toːkʲoː] ), officially the Tokyo Metropolis (東京都, Tōkyō-to), is the capital city of Japan and one of the most populous cities in the world, with a population of over 14 million residents as of 2023.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building
Tokyo.description: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building (東京都庁舎, Tōkyō-to Chōsha), also referred to as the Tochō (都庁) for short, is the seat of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, which governs the special wards, cities, towns, and villages that constitute the Tokyo Metropolis.

Tokyo.title: Tochōmae Station
Tokyo.description: Tochōmae Station (都庁前駅, Tochōmae-eki, Metropolitan Government Station) is a subway station on the Toei Ōedo Line in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the Tokyo subway operator Toei Subway.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Niagara Falls
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Niagara Falls is a fountain in Tokyo's Shinjuku Central Park, in Shinjuku, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Central Park
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Central Park or Shinjuku Chūō Park (新宿中央公園, Shinjuku chūō kōen) is a park in western Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Oak Tower
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku Oak Tower (新宿オークタワー) is a skyscraper located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Nishi-Shinjuku
Tokyo.description: Nishi-Shinjuku (西新宿, lit.

Tokyo.title: Juniso Kumano Shrine
Tokyo.description: Juniso Kumano Shrine (Japanese: 熊野神社) is a Kumano shrine in Nishi-Shinjuku (west Shinjuku), Tokyo, Japan, on the western side of Shinjuku Central Park.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Mitsui Building
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku Mitsui Building (新宿三井ビル, Shinjuku Mitsui Biru) is a high-rise building in Nishi-Shinjuku, Shinjuku, Tokyo.

Tokyo.title: Kogakuin University
Tokyo.description: Kogakuin University (工学院大学, Kōgakuin daigaku) is a private university in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Center Building
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku Center Building (新宿センタービル, Shinjuku Sentā Biru) is a skyscraper in the Nishi-Shinjuku business district in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Park Tower
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku Park Tower (新宿パークタワー, Shinjuku Pāku Tawā) is the second-tallest building in Shinjuku, Tokyo.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku I-Land Tower
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku I-Land Tower (新宿アイランドタワー) is an office skyscraper located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku L Tower
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku L Tower (新宿エルタワー) is a skyscraper located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Bunka Gakuen University
Tokyo.description: Bunka Gakuen University (文化学園大学, Bunka gakuen daigaku) is a private university in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Bunka Fashion College
Tokyo.description: Bunka Fashion College (文化服装学院, Bunka Fukusō Gakuin) is a Japanese vocational school specializing in fashion design and related disciplines.

Tokyo.title: Mode Gakuen Cocoon Tower
Tokyo.description: Mode Gakuen Cocoon Tower (モード学園コクーンタワー, Mōdo gakuen kokūn tawā) is a 204 metres (669 feet), 50-story educational facility located in the Nishi-Shinjuku district in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Sompo Japan Building
Tokyo.description: The Sompo Japan Head Office Building (損保ジャパン本社ビル, Sonpo Japan Honsha Biru) is the corporate headquarters for Sompo Japan Insurance.

Tokyo.title: Nishi-Shinjuku Station
Tokyo.description: Nishi-shinjuku Station (西新宿駅, Nishi-shinjuku-eki) is a Tokyo Metro railway station in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Highway Bus Terminal
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Highway Bus Terminal (新宿高速バスターミナル, Shinjuku Kōsoku-basu Tāminaru) was a bus terminal once operated by Keio Bus, in Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Nishi-shinjuku-gochome Station
Tokyo.description: Nishi-shinjuku-gochome Station (西新宿五丁目駅, Nishishinjuku Gochōme-eki) (alternative name 清水橋駅 Shimizubashi Station) is a train station on the Toei Oedo Line.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku-nishiguchi Station
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku-nishiguchi Station (新宿西口駅, Shinjuku-Nishiguchi-eki) is a subway station on the Toei Oedo Line in Tokyo, Japan, operated by the Tokyo subway operator Toei Subway.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Station
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Station (新宿駅, Shinjuku-eki) is a major railway station  in Tokyo, Japan, that serves as the main connecting hub for rail traffic between central/eastern Tokyo (the special wards) and Western Tokyo on the inter-city rail, commuter rail, and subway lines.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo Opera City Tower
Tokyo.description: Tokyo Opera City Tower (東京オペラシティタワー, Tōkyō Opera Shiti Tawā) is a skyscraper located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Expressway Bus Terminal
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Expressway Bus Terminal or Busta Shinjuku (バスタ新宿) is a major bus terminal that opened at Shinjuku Station South on 4 April 2016.

Tokyo.title: Japanese Sword Museum
Tokyo.description: The Japanese Sword Museum or Tōken hakubutsukan (刀剣博物館) situated in Tokyo, is a small museum dedicated to the art of Japanese swordmaking.

Tokyo.title: Minami-Shinjuku Station
Tokyo.description: Minami-Shinjuku Station (南新宿駅, Minami-Shinkuju-eki) is a railway station on the Odakyu Odawara Line in Shibuya-ku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the private railway operator Odakyu Electric Railway.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Musashinokan
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku Musashinokan (新宿武蔵野館) is a long-standing movie theater located on the east side of Shinjuku Station in Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: New National Theatre Tokyo
Tokyo.description: The New National Theatre, Tokyo (NNTT) (新国立劇場, Shin Kokuritsu Gekijō) is Japan's first and foremost national centre for the performing arts, including opera, ballet, contemporary dance and drama.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo Polytechnic University
Tokyo.description: Tokyo Polytechnic University (東京工芸大学, Tōkyō Kōgei Daigaku) is a private university in Honchō, Nakano, Tokyo.

Tokyo.title: Seibu-Shinjuku Station
Tokyo.description: Seibu-Shinjuku Station (西武新宿駅, Seibu-Shinjuku-eki) is a railway station in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the private railway operator Seibu Railway.

Tokyo.title: Jōgan-ji (Nakano, Tokyo)
Tokyo.description: Jōgan-ji (成願寺) is a Buddhist temple located in Honchō, Nakano, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Hatsudai Station
Tokyo.description: Hatsudai Station (初台駅, Hatsudai-eki) is a railway station on the Keio New Line in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the private railway operator Keio Corporation.

Tokyo.title: Myojo 56 building fire
Tokyo.description: The Myojo 56 building fire (明星56ビル火災, Myōjō Gojū-Roku Biru Kasai) was a structural fire that began at about 01:00 local time on September 1, 2001 in the Myojo 56 building, located in the Kabukichō section of Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Tokyu Kabukicho Tower
Tokyo.description: Tokyu Kabukicho Tower (東急歌舞伎町タワー, Tōkyū Kabukichō Tawā) is a 48-storey skyscraper located in the Kabukichō district of Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Godzilla head
Tokyo.description: The Godzilla head is a landmark and tourist attraction in Kabukichō, Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Koma Theater
Tokyo.description: The Shinjuku Koma Theater (新宿コマ劇場, Shinjuku Koma Gekijō) was a major theatre in the Kabukichō, Shinjuku, Tokyo.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Face
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Face (新宿FACE, Shinjuku feisu) is an event hall located on the 7th floor of the Humax Pavilion Shinjuku complex, 1-20-1 Kabukicho, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Robot Restaurant
Tokyo.description: Robot Restaurant was an entertainment venue operated by Robot Restaurant Co.

Tokyo.title: Yoyogi Station
Tokyo.description: Yoyogi Station (代々木駅, Yoyogi-eki) is a railway station in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) and the Tokyo Metropolitan Bureau of Transportation (Toei).

Tokyo.title: Nakano-sakaue Station
Tokyo.description: Nakano-sakaue Station (中野坂上駅, Nakano-sakaue-eki) is a subway station in Nakano, Tokyo, Japan, jointly operated by the two Tokyo subway operators Tokyo Metro and Toei Subway.

Tokyo.title: Hattori Nutrition College
Tokyo.description: Hattori Nutrition College (服部栄養専門学校, Hattori Eiyō Senmon Gakkō) is a cooking school in Yoyogi, Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: NTT Docomo Yoyogi Building
Tokyo.description: The NTT Docomo Yoyogi Building (NTTドコモ代々木ビル, Enu Tī Tī Dokomo Yoyogi Biru) is a skyscraper located in the Sendagaya district of Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo Mazu Temple
Tokyo.description: The Tokyo Mazu Temple (Japanese: 東京媽祖廟) is a Chinese temple dedicated to the sea goddess Mazu, located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Sangūbashi Station
Tokyo.description: Sangūbashi Station (参宮橋駅, Sangūbashi-eki) is a railway station on the Odakyu Odawara Line in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the private railway operator Odakyu Electric Railway.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Golden Gai
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Golden Gai (Japanese: 新宿ゴールデン街, Hepburn: Shinjuku gōruden-gai) is a district of Kabukicho within Shinjuku, a special ward of Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Hanazono Shrine
Tokyo.description: The Hanazono Shrine (花園神社, Hanazono Jinja) is a Shinto shrine located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku-sanchōme Station
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku-sanchome Station (新宿三丁目駅, Shinjuku-sanchōme-eki) is a subway station in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated jointly by the two Tokyo subway operators, Tokyo Metro and Toei Subway.

Tokyo.title: Ōkubo Station (Tokyo)
Tokyo.description: Ōkubo Station (大久保駅, Ōkubo-eki) is a railway station on the Chūō-Sōbu Line in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by East Japan Railway Company (JR East).

Tokyo.title: Kabukichō
Tokyo.description: Kabukichō (Japanese: 歌舞伎町, pronounced [kabɯki̥ tɕoː]) is an entertainment district in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Ni-chōme
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Ni-chōme (新宿二丁目), referred to colloquially as  Ni-chōme or simply Nichō, is Area 2 in the Shinjuku District of the Shinjuku Special Ward of Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Yodobashi
Tokyo.description: Yodobashi ward (淀橋区, Yodobashi-ku) is one of the 35 former wards of Tokyo-Fu, Tokyo City.

Tokyo.title: Shin-Ōkubo Station
Tokyo.description: Shin-Ōkubo Station (新大久保駅, Shin-Ōkubo-eki) is a railway station on the Yamanote Line in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by East Japan Railway Company (JR East).

Tokyo.title: Ōkubo, Tokyo
Tokyo.description: Ōkubo (大久保), also known as Shin-Ōkubo (新大久保), is a neighborhood in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Takanohana stable
Tokyo.description: Takanohana stable (貴乃花部屋, Takanohana-beya) was a stable of sumo wrestlers, created in 2004 when Takanohana Kōji took over the running of Futagoyama stable from his father Takanohana Kenshi.

Tokyo.title: Meiji Shrine
Tokyo.description: Meiji Shrine (明治神宮, Meiji Jingū) is a Shinto shrine in Shibuya, Tokyo, that is dedicated to the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji and his wife, Empress Shōken.

Tokyo.title: Nakano-shimbashi Station
Tokyo.description: Nakano-shimbashi Station (中野新橋駅, Nakano-shinbashi-eki) is a subway station on the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line in Nakano, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the Tokyo subway operator Tokyo Metro.

Tokyo.title: Yoyogikamizonochō
Tokyo.description: Yoyogikamizonochō (代々木神園町) is a district of Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Higashi-shinjuku Station
Tokyo.description: Higashi-shinjuku Station (東新宿駅, Higashi-shinjuku-eki) is a subway station in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the two Tokyo subway operators Tokyo Metropolitan Bureau of Transportation (Toei) and Tokyo Metro.

Tokyo.title: Kita-sando Station
Tokyo.description: Kita-sando Station (北参道駅, Kita-sandō-eki) is a subway station on the Tokyo Metro Fukutoshin Line in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the Tokyo subway operator Tokyo Metro.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku-gyoemmae Station
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku-gyoemmae Station (新宿御苑前駅, Shinjuku-gyoen-mae-eki) is a subway station on the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, operated by the Tokyo subway operator Tokyo Metro.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Gyo-en
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Gyo-en (新宿御苑, literally 'Shinjuku Imperial Garden') or Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden is a large public garden in Shinjuku and Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Meiji Shrine Outer Garden
Tokyo.description: Meiji Shrine Outer Garden (明治神宮外苑, Meiji-jingū Gaien) is a Western-style garden in the Kasumigaokamachi neighborhood of Shinjuku Ward and the Aoyama neighborhood of Minato Ward in Tokyo.

Tokyo.title: Yoyogi
Tokyo.description: Yoyogi (代々木) is a neighbourhood in the northern part of Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo Kōsei Nenkin Kaikan
Tokyo.description: Tokyo Kōsei Nenkin Kaikan (東京厚生年金会館), also known as Wel City Tokyo, was a 2,062-seat (1st floor: 1,186 seats, 2nd floor: 876 seats) concert hall in Tokyo, one of a number of public concert halls in Japan called Kōsei Nenkin Kaikan.

Tokyo.title: National Noh Theatre
Tokyo.description: The National Noh Theatre (国立能楽堂, Kokuritsu Nōgaku Dō) opened in Sendagaya, Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan in September 1983.

Tokyo.title: Panasonic Globe Theatre
Tokyo.description: The Panasonic Globe Theatre in Tokyo, Japan, was designed by Isozaki Arata and  opened in 1988 to showcase local and international productions of Shakespeare's plays.

Tokyo.title: Horikoshi High School
